conclusion: Identify forces acting on the latch during self-locking.
The spring force F_s = kx acts horizontally, pushing the latch into the lock groove.
The normal force N acts perpendicular to the surface of the latch.
The frictional force f = μN opposes the sliding motion.
The force F is applied to move the door.
Resolve forces into horizontal and vertical components.
The component of the normal force perpendicular to the inclined surface is N cos θ.
The component of friction f = μN parallel to the inclined surface is N sin θ.
For equilibrium, horizontal components must balance: kx = N cos θ + μN sin θ.
Substitute θ = 30° using cos 30° = √3/2 and sin 30° = 1/2.
Rearrange the equation to solve for N: N = 2kx/(√3 + μ).
The magnitude of the normal force N between the latch and the lock groove at self-locking is N = 2kx/(√3 + μ).
